reviews.review: Great little horde bonding game. Controls are different and there is a language to be learned in them, but it isn't to the point that it isn't uplayable to newer players. Some degree of strategy does exist for the ultimate and most efficient team and loadout for each class, but teamwork and skill can overcome almost any odds. Like most horde games, map knowledge is important and unfortunetly, even with constant ingame help on the HUD, maps are very dark and a little convoluted making it hard to navigate through. While this helps create more of a world and feeling, it does create a barrier to entry which isn't player based but more time based, as only experience and knowledge can overcome map design. Also, the enemies while diverse enough to make gameplay constant and "fresh", there are some where it isn't clear on what the threat level is. Though this didn't really matter as almost every game I was in, I got to "exerience" each enemy type through my commrades deaths and reactions, it is still something to reintroduceeach enemies to all the players. I think that restateing important information is always welcomed as long as it isn't too obstructive. Either way, its a fun game, though I think the official skins and weapons which are purely cosmetic are a bit pricy.
This is a classic survival horror game that needs great cooperation to beat higher level maps. It is highly recommended to those who love challenges and survival horror games.

A fast-paced, Co-op oriented splatter fest where you and up to 5 other people fight to stay alive amid waves of grotesque medical experiments. Your classes give you specific bonuses that level up as you fight and support your team. There is a wide variety of maps and (cosmetic) characters to choose from. 

Weapon selection is extremely varied and shot discipline is /KEY/. That's not to say you can't spray and pray or open up with a weapon like the flame thrower, but a series of well aimed pistol shots can be extremely effective at clearing a group.

If you love working together as a team I cannot express just how awesome a game this is. Also, Tripwire Interactive is extremely community oriented and conducts several Holiday events a year. Enemies are re-skinned, maps/weapons are added, along with character-skin unlocking Achievements.

Killing Floor is probably one of the best co-op FPS's of all time. While I'm not a huge fan of leveling systems in FPS games, it works here because you don't have to fight against people who've already unlocked everything (and who could likely wipe the floor with you). But don't think the game is easy just because of that. It's not uncommon for even an experienced team to get overwhelmed in later rounds.

The game's buying-between-rounds system lets you really change how you play and adapt to the skill level of your teammates. If you're playing with a lot of good people, you could pick up less-effective weapons and just have fun. If your team is struggling, you can go for your bread-and-butter weapons and mop up. You can switch roles between rounds as well, so maybe you're not helping out so much as a Firebug and your team is taking too much damage. You could switch to medic and see a huge turnaround in your team's performance.

The aiming is as accurate as you are, and that's a seriously refereshing reward. No artificial inaccuracy or auto-aiming here. There's also no bullet-drop, so it's really a blend of realism and arcadish fun. You have to balance weapon load out with movement speed. The more you carry, the slower you go. Also, you have to be proficient at switching to the right weapon for the job. If you think you can pick any class and one weapon and just mow down every specimen in the game, think again. A support specialist with the right shotgun can solo a flesh pound with little practice. However, a commando with a bullpup should probably just switch to their knife and run away (like CS, you have to switch to your knife if you want to run).

One of the few downsides to the game is that there is a lack of variety in enemies on any given map. You'll see the exact same set of enemies over and over again. If you don't absolutely fall in love with the game mechanics, I suspect this will be the aspect of the game that destroys replayability the fastest. It'd be nice to see a couple different models or skins for the same enemy type (like how the plain zombies in L4D1 & 2 don't all look the same). It'd also be nice to see a new enemy type (something I don't think we've ever seen from TripWire Interactive).

However, you do get variety in the form of seasonal events which TWI is very good about putting on every year. Often they'll release new content (new map, new character, new weapons, balance tweaks, etc.), and they also reskin all enemies for these events. The graphics may be starting to show their age, but the gameplay is still unique and fun. It's a game that may not have the strongest foundation when it was released, but its content, stability, and overall quality has grown over the years. It's still played by many and easy to pick up at a great price during a steam sale.

If you like challenging FPSs and enjoy co-op, definitely give this game a try.

For those who don't already know this game, it's a quality shoot em up zombie fps filled with variety and English accents. Easy to pick up, yet difficult in the demand for strategy and skill development. Hours of game-play that will always satisfy. Best played with friends and gets more challenging with each player added meaning all the more enjoyment. 10 waves of pure giblet-spraying awesomeness.

If wave based survival coop is your thing, then this is your game. Constant dev support, custom maps and included SDK result in an endless amount of mods that keep the game alive long past its due date. Holiday events, the Aliens and Dead Space mods are a must.
Nice game with good graphics. Can run easily on any computer and is really addicting. I especially love the slow motion parts!

This game is perfect when having LAN parties with 4 or more players. It is non stop action and I wish they would make a sequel to this game with improved graphics but staying true to the fun factor of the game.

did you evercome home from a rough day rough day and you just need some mindless shooting to unwind? this game is perfect for that. With just enough of a progression system to keep you interested and quick  waves with a lot of diversity, killing floor is the Warioware of shooters.
Probably the best first person co-op game on my list! Incredibly fun, freaky monsters, and updated events for holidays or known weeks. Just freakin' awesome, long story short. 9/10.

Killing Floor is a decent game.  The gameplay feels slightly choppy like everything else tripwire has to offer, but the atmosphere and variety of weapons/scenarios makes up for it.  As far as horror games go, it's fairly enjoyable, with the monsters being visceral and haunting.  One of the biggest drawbacks is the lack of an intuitive menu system, one which also makes quickly selecting a weapon in the heat of the moment difficult.  Overall, it's a better-than-average horror game that any fan of the genre should try out.

One of the very first games I picked up after completing my PC build was Left 4 Dead 2, and while I still love that game I have to say that I prefer this over that in a big way.  A lot of this can be attributed to the community, and what I mean by that is that most Killing Floor players I have come across are hard core horror film addicts and fans of all things dark...just like me.

Aside from the community though Killing Floor offers some seriously satisfying gun play, a wonderfully nostalgic PC game feel (Unreal Engine), and an amazingly diverse set of maps.  This is an amazingly fun and rewarding multiplayer experience that I'd recommend to anyone.

Para todo aquel que esté buscando un FPS basado en cooperativo, de sobrevivir rondas contra enemigos (no recuerdo si tiene algún nombre ese estilo). El juego resulta adictivo más de lo que pueda uno pensar. Gráficamente cumple de sobra, y el control está bien llevado; como todo FPS que se precie, gran fluided y un justo equilibrio entre munición y curas.

Si se da la oportunidad de probarlo, hacedlo, incluso si no os gusta el género especialmente. Es de esos juegos que pueden llegar a gustar simplemente por diversión pura y dura. 

La variedad de enemigos no es excesiva, en armamento está bien servido, y los micropagos insertados en el juego (DLC más bien) no interfieren en la jugabilidad que posee un usuario cualquiera con el juego sin más. 

80/100

great game with friends. offers a decent fps experince, with a variety of weopons any class can use, and even more if you get dlc. what would make this game better would be a campaign, which it does not have. its straight up killing crazy zombies that come out of no where.

Truly, this game is something amazing. Since the my purchase of Killing Floor 2, I've regretted not playing Killing Floor to death.
The mechanics of this game are refreshing- for example, no hip fire crosshairs, there is a tradeoff between mobility and power- and although the gameplay feels rigid and Killing Floor 2 flows much smoother (and is overall a better game), this game has an undefinable quality that makes it a classic that will always remain in my library, ready to play (probably nostalgia).
This Game is simply perfection.
